sub_topic: Predicting the solubility of inorganic salts in water
message_1: What is the solubility of copper(II) sulfate pentahydrate in water at 25°C?
message_2: The solubility of copper(II) sulfate pentahydrate (CuSO4·5H2O) in water at 25°C is approximately 23.1 grams per 100 mL of water. This means that 23.1 grams of copper(II) sulfate pentahydrate can dissolve in 100 mL of water at 25°C to form a saturated solution.
